Title: How to prove that the Fibonacci sequence is periodic mod 5 without using induction?
Content:
The sequence $(F_{n})$ of Fibonacci numbers is defined by the recurrence relation $$F_{n}=F_{n-1}+F_{n-2}$$ 
for all $n \geq 2$
with $F_{0} := 0$
and 
$F_{1} :=1$. Without mathematical induction,
how can I show that
$$F_{n}\equiv F_{n+20}\pmod 5$$
for all $n \geq 2$?
AcceptedAnswer:
In mod $5$, $$\begin{align}F_N&\equiv F_{N-1}+F_{N-2}\\&\equiv F_{N-2}+F_{N-3}+F_{N-3}+F_{N-4}\\&\equiv F_{N-3}+F_{N-4}+2(F_{N-4}+F_{N-5})+F_{N-4}\\&\equiv F_{N-4}+F_{N-5}+F_{N-4}+2(F_{N-4}+F_{N-5})+F_{N-4}\\&\equiv 3F_{N-5}\end{align}$$
So, we have $$\begin{align}F_{n+20}&\equiv3F_{n+15}\\&\equiv 3\cdot 3F_{n+10}\\&\equiv 3\cdot 3\cdot 3F_{n+5}\\&\equiv 3\cdot 3\cdot 3\cdot 3F_{n}\\&\equiv F_n\end{align}$$
